alert.note: Alert for Gila; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 4:44AM MST until March 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected across the advisory area. Flood warnings and advisories remain in effect for several waterways in northern Arizona. * WHERE...Northern Gila and eastern Yavapai counties. * WHEN...Until 700 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and streams is occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 AM MST, stream gauges showed elevated flow across area waterways due to rain and snowmelt. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes many of the creeks, washes and rivers across the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Payson, Camp Verde, Chino Valley, Sedona, Prescott Valley, Prescott, Clarkdale, Dewey-humboldt, Star Valley, Cordes Lakes, Cordes Junction, Spring Valley, Cordes, Childs Power Plant, Bumble Bee, Cherry, Middle Verde, Mayer, Montezuma Castle National Monument and Mcguireville. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
